ingredients.name: Caramel
ingredients.overview: Brown colouring made by heating sugar
ingredients.what_it_is: A brown colouring produced by carefully heating sugar until it caramelises, used for colouring food and drinks
ingredients.why_its_used: Adds brown colour to foods and beverages, creates caramel flavour in confectionery
ingredients.where_it_comes_from: Made by controlled heating of carbohydrates (sugars) with or without acids or alkalis
ingredients.typicalUses: Cola drinks, beer, brown bread, sauces, gravy, confectionery, desserts
ingredients.effectsSummary: Made from heated sugar. Plain caramel (E150a) is considered the safest type of caramel colouring.
ingredients.concerns: Some caramel colours (E150c, E150d) contain 4-MEI, a potential concern. E150a plain caramel is considered safer.

ingredients.concerns: None - considered safe and is used in home baking

ingredients.name: Vanilla extract
ingredients.overview: Natural flavouring extracted from vanilla beans
ingredients.what_it_is: A solution made by macerating and percolating vanilla pods in a mixture of water and ethanol
ingredients.why_its_used: Adds sweet, aromatic vanilla flavour to baked goods, desserts, and beverages
ingredients.where_it_comes_from: Extracted from cured vanilla orchid pods (Vanilla planifolia) grown in tropical regions
ingredients.typicalUses: Cakes, biscuits, ice cream, chocolate, custard, flavoured milk drinks
ingredients.effectsSummary: Natural plant extract, widely used in home cooking and commercially
ingredients.concerns: None - natural flavouring considered safe

ingredients.name: Vegetable carbon
ingredients.overview: Vegetable carbon used as a colour.
ingredients.what_it_is: Vegetable carbon used as a colour.
ingredients.why_its_used: Confectionery, beverages, desserts, bakery icings.
ingredients.typicalUses: Confectionery, beverages, desserts, bakery icings.
ingredients.effectsSummary: Generally recognised as safe at permitted use levels.
ingredients.concerns: Generally recognised as safe at permitted use levels.

ingredients.name: Vegetable fat
ingredients.overview: Fats extracted from various plant sources
ingredients.what_it_is: Fats extracted from plants such as palm, coconut, rapeseed, sunflower, or other oil-bearing crops
ingredients.why_its_used: Provides texture, mouthfeel, and shelf stability in processed foods at lower cost than butter
ingredients.where_it_comes_from: Extracted and refined from various plant sources including palm, coconut, sunflower, rapeseed seeds or fruits
ingredients.typicalUses: Baked goods, confectionery, spreads, fried foods, processed snacks
ingredients.effectsSummary: Plant-derived fats that are refined and processed. Quality depends on source and processing method.
ingredients.concerns: Often refined and may be high in saturated fat (palm, coconut). Processing level varies. Check for hydrogenation.

sources.title: NHS: Different fats - the facts
sources.covers: Health impacts of different types of fats

ingredients.name: Whey powder
synonyms: lactose and protein from whey (from milk)
ingredients.overview: Dried whey - the liquid remaining after milk has been curdled and strained
ingredients.what_it_is: The dried powder form of whey, the watery part of milk that separates from the curds during cheese making
ingredients.why_its_used: Adds protein, improves texture, enhances browning, and provides a source of lactose in processed foods
ingredients.where_it_comes_from: By-product of cheese and yogurt production, spray-dried into powder form
ingredients.typicalUses: Baked goods, confectionery, processed cheese, protein supplements, infant formula
ingredients.effectsSummary: Dairy by-product that undergoes processing. Natural source of protein and lactose.
ingredients.concerns: Contains lactose - unsuitable for lactose intolerant individuals. Dairy allergen.

ingredients.name: Whey protein isolate
ingredients.effectsSummary: Highly refined dairy protein
ingredients.concerns: Highly refined dairy protein

ingredients.name: Xanthan gum
ingredients.overview: Xanthan gum is a hydrocolloid used to thicken or stabilise texture.
ingredients.what_it_is: Xanthan gum is a hydrocolloid used to thicken or stabilise texture.
ingredients.why_its_used: Ice cream, sauces, dressings, bakery, confectionery.
ingredients.typicalUses: Ice cream, sauces, dressings, bakery, confectionery.
ingredients.effectsSummary: Generally recognised as safe at permitted use levels.
ingredients.concerns: Generally recognised as safe at permitted use levels.
